messages.message: With update to bazel, how do we run tests locally for certain directories where `ibtest` is now failing. Example: running `ibtest data_api_utils._sheet.test_aihub_build_fns.TestAihubFunctions` in `/Users/sayd/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/data-api-utils`  is not working
I tried `make bazel-build bazel-test` but getting errors
ran 0 tests. maybe some module was removed by accident?

We are discussing the c error on this thread now.
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C070H1089H8/p1719519913812749

> ran 0 tests. maybe some module was removed by accident?
Did you use bazel to run tests?
Just trying to run tests locally

That doesn’t run bazel test. It uses the traditional build system.
Could you try it on crafting by any chance? You can run `make bazel-test`
Ah, I don't have crafting set up. I run these services locally for backend development

Hope the thread below helps.
Everyone has a different dev env on macos, so there’s a limit to what we can help with unfortunately :confused: .
For that reason, we strongly recommend setting up crafting, but let me know if you are still struggling with the error even after trying the steps below!

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C070H1089H8/p1719525479988789?thread_ts=1719519913.812749&cid=C070H1089H8
